intro: Secamone insularis, commonly known as the island secamone, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves and stems, which help it adapt to the arid conditions of its habitat. It produces small, berry-like fruits that contain the seeds. Secamone insularis is notable for its striking appearance and is considered an endemic species found only on Socotra.
